The tweet shared by Sarah Damaske: an associate professor of labor and employment relations at Penn State University, linking to a federal court decision regarding North Carolina's voter ID law.
The court decision itself: which stated that North Carolina admitted to stopping Sunday voting because counties with Sunday voting were disproportionately black and blacks disproportionately vote Democrat.
The passage of the voter ID law in 2013: which shortened the early voting period, eliminated same-day voter registration, and eliminated two Sunday voting dates.
The overturning of the voter ID law by t: S. Court of Appeals for the 4th Circuit, which deemed the law's justifications as "erroneous" and highlighted the disproportionate impact on African Americans.
